lines.text: Sir... to my knowledge, your son never said... he believed in something, unless he believed it.
I would like nothing better... than to understand my boy.
He's the only man I've ever met, black or white, who saw me for what I am. What I really am.
But he has some truth on his side.
"Truth"? But how can he have truth on his side and not God?
He was on your side, which makes what happened...
He was on no one's side, sir. Except, perhaps... yours and mine.
